snippet: The airline said it would give special safety training, including an enhanced program for visual approaches and automated flight, after the crash of an Asiana jet in San Francisco.
abstract: Asiana Airlines of South Korea says it will give special safety training to its pilots, including an enhanced program for visual approaches and automated flight, after the crash of one of its Boeing 777 jets at San Francisco International Airport.

byline.original: By CHOE SANG-HUN and MATTHEW L. WALD
byline.contributor: Choe Sang-Hun reported from Seoul, South Korea, and Matthew L. Wald from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The airline said it would give special safety training, including an enhanced program for visual approaches and automated flight, after the crash of an Asiana jet in San Francisco.

headline.main: After Jet Crash, Asiana Airlines Will Bolster Its Pilot Training
headline.print_headline: After Jet Crash, Asiana Airlines Will Bolster Its Pilot Training
